bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Domingo F. Ramos, May 1, 1941

div1.p: Hench requests Ramos' help in raising funds for a memorial in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Domingo F. Ramos, May 1, 1941
div1.opener:
Copy to Moran
May 1, 1941
His Excellency, Dr. Domingo F. Ramos
Minister of Defense
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Ramos:
div1.p:
It was a great pleasure indeed for me to visit Havana again
and to meet you and your colleagues, renewing the real friendships which I
made there last year. I value these friendships very highly and I deem it
a real privilege to have been able to help with the rediscovery of Camp Lazear
and to be able to join a movement to memorialize properly these sites.

You will remember the letter which you dictated to Miss Malaret
in the library of the Finlay Institute in which letter you kindly expressed
your acceptance of my report to you. I believe Miss Malaret was going to send
me both the Spanish and the English translation, signed by you. I have not
as yet received this, and am somewhat concerned lest it might have been lost.
You will appreciate that such a letter will be very helpful to me in approach-
ing my American colleagues, asking for their financial help. I am sure they
will do nothing until they have been assured by such documents as your letter
that my report was accepted and that my findings are deemed correct by the
Cuban government.

I shall keep you and Dr. Recio informed of the progress of
my campaign. I hope that I can find enough American colleagues to help me
with this venture without calling for the help of the Cuban government, but
if not, perhaps we can make this a cooperative venture.

Please let me thank you again for the many courtecies which
you extended to me. The various authorities at the Military Hospital were
most courteous in helping me get the data that I wanted.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
